sentence.Network_en: Dart, who had at first been very tense, at last relaxed.
sentence.Network_cn: 起初，达特非常紧张，最后终于放松了下来。

sentence.Network_en: She seemed nervous or tense, and she was definitely short with me.
sentence.Network_cn: 她似乎很焦虑，抑或是很紧张，对我明显很不客气。

sentence.Network_en: My arms are tired, and my back is tense.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的胳膊很累，背部肌肉紧绷得难受。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 时态（Tense）是表示行为、动作和状态在各种时间条件下的动词形式。因此，当我们说时态结构的时候，指的是相应时态下的动词形 …
九年级英语单词表 ... to start with 首先 tense 紧张的；焦虑的 schoolbag 书包.
高一英语词汇表 ... mean adj. 卑鄙的；吝啬的 tense adj. 紧张的；拉紧的 dull adj. 迟钝的；无趣的；呆滞的.
时间( Time)和时( Tense)不同。时间(Time)是一个概念，而时(Tense)财是语法上的称谓。

list.abs: 一种是过去式(Past Tense)，另一种是过去分词(Past Participle)。过去分词前面一定要有一个词例如is, got, have因为过去分词是被动 …
所有tenses的用法_百度知道 ... present tense n.[语]现在时 future tense n. [语法]将来时 tense up 紧张.
而完成式 (perfect tense)是发生在过去。过去发生并且已经完成的动作对现在造成影响或后果，过去某一时间开始并一直持续到现在并 …
用现在式（present tense）：当你书写人生目标时，假装你已经完成目标，用现在式来描述，避免用「将要」等类似的未来式表述法 …
Past)两种；但它们和时态(Tenses)上所指的现在时态(Present Tense)和过去时态(Past Tense)是有所不同的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from Latin tensus 'stretched', from the verb tendere
Middle English (in the general sense 'time'): from Old French tens, from Latin tempus 'time'

entry.tran: (局势、时期)令人紧张的，让人焦虑的
entry.def: A tense situation or period of time is one that makes people anxious, because they do not know what is going to happen next.

example.ex: This gesture of goodwill did little to improve the tense atmosphere at the talks...
example.tran: 这一友好姿态基本上没有改善会谈的紧张气氛。

example.ex: After three very tense weeks he phoned again...
example.tran: 过了紧张不安的 3 个星期，他又一次打来电话。

entry.tran: 紧张的;焦虑的;无法放松的
entry.def: If you are tense, you are anxious and nervous and cannot relax.

example.ex: Dart, who had at first been very tense, at last relaxed.
example.tran: 起初，达特非常紧张，最后终于放松了下来。

entry.def: If your body is tense, your muscles are tight and not relaxed.

example.ex: She lay, eyes shut, body tense...
example.tran: 她躺着，双目紧闭，全身绷直。

example.ex: A bath can relax tense muscles.
example.tran: 洗个澡可以放松紧张的肌肉。

entry.def: If your muscles tense, if you tense, or if you tense your muscles, your muscles become tight and stiff, often because you are anxious or frightened.

example.ex: He tensed as the big West Indian gripped his shoulder...
example.tran: 那个大块头西印度群岛土著人抓住他的肩膀时，他浑身紧张起来。

entry.def: The tense of a verb group is its form, which usually shows whether you are referring to past, present, or future time.

example.ex: It was as though Corinne was already dead: they were speaking of her in the past tense.
example.tran: 科琳娜好像已经去世了：他们谈论她时用的是过去时。

means.word_mean: 1. a grammatical category of verbs used to express distinctions of time
1. stretch or force to the limit;

sentences.sentence: "He tensed up when he saw his opponent enter the room"

means.word_mean: 4. make tense and uneasy or nervous or anxious;
1. in or of a state of physical or nervous tension
2. pronounced with relatively tense tongue muscles (e.g., the vowel sound in `beat')

stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tens伸展,趋向+ive……的→伸出去的→广大的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 强烈的,剧烈的;热烈的,热情的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in加强+tens伸展,趋向+e→拉紧→强烈的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 强烈的, 精深的, 透彻的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intense[adj.强烈的,剧烈的;热烈的,热情的]+ive表形容词→adj.强烈的, 精深的, 透彻的
tens伸展,趋向+e→adj.紧张的, 拉紧的 v.[使]紧张,[使]拉紧
tens伸展,趋向+ible能……的→adj.可伸长的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可拉长的, 可伸长的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tens伸展,趋向+ile表形容词→adj.可拉长的, 可伸长的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 延长;扩大;范围;大小;尺寸;电话分机
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tens伸展,趋向+ion表名词→伸出去→扩张

stems_affixes.value_cn: 强烈, 剧烈, 强度;亮度
stems_affixes.word_buile: intense[adj.强烈的,剧烈的;热烈的,热情的]+ity表名词→n.强烈, 剧烈, 强度;亮度
pre前+tens伸展,趋向+ion表名词→提前摆出一种姿态→自负
tens伸展,趋向+ion表名词→伸展出的状态→紧张
tens伸展,趋向+ity表名词→n.紧张, 紧张度

tens伸展,趋向+e→adj.紧张的, 拉紧的 v.[使]紧张,[使]拉紧

Sentence.sentence: Instead of having a literal meaning, it docs something - conveying an attitude — just like the -ed ending conveys past tense rather than "meaning.
relations between whites and African Americans may become tense again

sentences.en: I cannot play the piano like I used to—my fingers have gone tense from lack of practice.
sentences.cn: 我不能像过去那样弹钢琴了——我的手指因缺乏练习变得生硬了。

sentences.en: He read the letter with a tense anxiety.
sentences.cn: 他紧张焦虑地看那封信。
我们因期待而神经紧张起来。

jushi.english: The two countries began to discuss their tense relations.
jushi.chinese: 这两国开始讨论他们之间的紧张关系。

jushi.english: He read the letter with a tense anxiety.
jushi.chinese: 他紧张焦虑地看那封信。
